threads.com:
Welcome to the official /mlp/ Secret Santa 2022 thread! Tell Santa all your wildest wishes and come join us in sending cards, gifts, and cheer to your fellow Pony lovers!
Sign-ups are closed and gift and card assignments are out.
Latecomers signups are ongoing.
HEY! CHECK IN TO THE THREAD. Make sure to check your emails and check into the thread so that your Santa knows that you’re alive and can ask you questions.

>How’s this thing work?
Read the FAQ!
The short form:
Gifts are given Round Robin Circle Jerk style (A gives to B gives to C who gives to A) while cards are exchanged traditionally (whomever you give a card to should send one back to you). You will be randomly assigned anons by email after the signups are over so please keep an eye out!

Latecomers are now OPEN.
The form can be found here: derpy.me/mMJhT
Sign ups close at 11:59pm CT on the 30th of November, no exceptions!

Nov the past: Gift assignments out. Card assignments out.
Dec 1st - 10th: The latest suggested mailing period. Consider mailing on the early side if you’re shipping internationally.

FAG here: https://fag.anonfilly.com/

Coordinator email for comments/concerns/general inquiries: MLPSecretSanta2022@gmail.com
Contact for questions about any card issues: thecardslut@gmail.com
Kiwi: Resident corpse, international correspondent, and expert in dealing with people who don't understand deadlines. kiwilatecomers@gmail.com

>WHERE’S MY SANTEE/SANTA?!
I’m my basement.
Hey you goofballs, you need to CHECK IN.

>BUT IT’S NOT EVEN THANKSMAS YET! REEEEE!
YES! IT! IS!
We are in the thick of it now. Get those gifts and cards out the door. Get those crafts finished.
And while you wait for the glue to dry or the parcels to arrive join us in thread and draw a cute OC, write a song, join a giveaway, chat about your holiday plans, and just spend some time with us here in the thread.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>39379509
It's funny, it's like kinderquestria but weaponized. The idea that humans are all treated as toddlers throwing indignant tantrums who might hurt themselves if not ponified reaches me on a deep level. It's like they're the real adults in a world full of grown-up children, as if the worst of the human condition is just the result of humans being in a species-wide teenage angst and that humans only fight back because they're irrationality attached to that. When they get ponified they don't care about old grudges, personal convictions or prejudices because they know that no pony would ever give them a reason to hold one and no human can be blamed for behaviour they would sooner consider an embarrassing moment than a credible threat. I don't think it's a show-accurate interpretation of ponies but plenty of good greens are built on the premise of an inevitable pony utopia and the humans who fight to preserve aspects of humanity that I don't think anyone would miss in a world where ponification renders them redundant.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>39379573
>plenty of good greens are built on the premise of an inevitable pony utopia and the humans who fight to preserve aspects of humanity that I don't think anyone would miss in a world where ponification renders them redundant.
I can't think of many good ones with this premise, but I can think of plenty which assume that humanity is entirely irredeemably flawed and every single person would be objectively improved by becoming a pony. And that that's cheap and boring: firstly, "just become pony bro and your mind will be rewritten to be good(rm) and kind(tm)" feels like a cop-out by someone who wants to be better but wants to put in zero effort, so they fantasize that there's a magic wand that can make them a better person. And secondly, "all humans are irredeemably evil and flawed and ONLY ponies can be good and deserve to live" reads just like an edgy 14 year old's misanthropic power fantasy.

I honestly can't think of any greens that make mass ponification a good thing but don't fall into one (or more often, both) of those traps.
Maybe TCB is to blame, as it popularised the misanthropic plot trope and now almost all mass-ponification stories follow its format.

>>39378773
You seem like you're at the stage of learning to draw where you've nearly perfected the method you're doing. There isn't really much room to improve further, not with just a simple pencil. Get into alternate stuff, it's time to expand your small scope and limited toolkit to something that suits the level you're at. Look at professional writing/drawing tools, maybe get into digital, figure out methods and tools you aren't using yet.

At the beginning of learning to draw, you really do need to practice hard with just a simple pencil for months or years so that your wrist + brain can get better at making shapes elegantly. But you're clearly at the point where continuing to do only that is producing diminishing returns. Right now it's as though you are trying to learn math, but you're just practicing out of the same 7th grade text books over and over again. Your skill level is higher than that now, you need better tools and education on medium-skilled techniques.

Now that you are at the point where your arm can draw shapes of reasonable accuracy, you can get a lot better in a very short amount of time. But you need to graduate from the caveman-tier tools and knowledge you're working with right now. Get out there.

>>39374974
Cool ideas with showing future eventualities. An alternative implementation to a full game state copy would be making the operations reversible. So at the start of the turn it could start recording rewind data for various operations. For example to reverse removing a random element the random index and the element would have to be saved, for reversing stack pops the popped elements would have to be saved say in another stack and then pushed back in the correct order, and so on. I imagine that this would be faster for short rewinds then making a copy of the full game state or using persistent data structures.

>>39375841
I would start by collecting the language/engine procedures in the documentation to make sure that you can eventually do the hardest or most important features that you want. If it's not too hard to reorganize cards at a board granularity then don't bother implementing something else first. If you start running into too many problems and you want to keep up the pace of progress then adjust accordingly. The rest of the features can be reworked if the language/engine doesn't support them. Then you can do whatever you want in pretty much whatever order you want if the interface is abstracted enough. Starting with the things that are most difficult or slowest to run would get them out of the way sooner although that can also lead to frustrated burnout. Different strokes for different folks if something isn't working for you then shake it up because there's lots of different ways to make things work.

Keeping a list of snapshots is simpler and would probably perform fine for a game like this, where the state changes only infrequently (when the player plays a card, more or less). Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

What is a 'Satyr Abomination' thread about?
A satyr is what happens when a human and a pony decide to get freaky and end up having a child. The top half is mostly human, the bottom is from pony mom (or pony dad). This thread is dedicated to the art and written works about these lovable creatures.
>What about other species?
The show had quite a few different intelligent species by season 8, 'everycreature' and all. Pick your poison, but /mlp/ is mainly into ponies.
>What is the world/characters/personalities & attributes?
The most common setting is one or multiple Anons in Equestria. Most of the established characters are in the list below, the personalities mostly vary from green to green. Just ask the thread about common headcanons.

>>39370655
>is the demon world still dead?
The demon world is irrecoverable. space and causal time are broken in the entire star system and energy cannot be exchanged at all. Anyone in it is effectively immortal and ageless because they become an almost completely closed system. You know how one of the fundamentals of physics is that if something isn't affected by external forces, it'll continue to move at the same speed and direction forever? Yeah.
The only thing keeping anyone going there from instantly being not-quite-killed (The way the demons put it Equestria/Earth/Appyr's world are in the horizontal plane, while they themselves were in the vertical plane; the physics themselves were essentially incompatible, and space/time breaking made it even worse) are some faint magics left to allow visitors in their planet that are preserved by the stasis.

>And Anon, is he dead?
Nope. Was close, thou.

>Is the war between the Amulen and the leech
thingies closer or farther than it was before?
The "war" ended thousands of years ago, the leeches came, took what they wanted after a spat, and went. The only thing it lasted anything at all was the leeches are very economic about how much resources they put in any one front.
The demons realized early that anyone advanced enough to push back the leeches had ascended to higher planes, and had reason to believe they were on the very brink of doing the same thing. Without anyone who could really help, and everyone they contacted attracting the attention of the leeches and being destroyed in days, they choose not to ask for aid or even notice anymore allies of the situation. It's why Equestria never found out they had been destroyed.
Not everything is lost, however. I'll write a short story to elaborate on that later.

threads.name: QM
threads.com:
>Space.... may be the final frontier, but it also sure as fuck is the most boring one
>It might have been something very special a millenia ago, back when the first pony left Equestria
>But as you drift through the endless void inside of your tin can you can't help but be bored beyond belief
>Out here you don't even get access to any of the station radios to take your mind off of the inky blackness
>And while you'd love to say that you could have just played some music you loaded onto your ship's board computer...
>The entire ship goes dark as if it knew what you were thinking about, the humming power core silencing itself
>You groan in annoyance and unbuckle yourself as you gently begin floating upwards in the lack of gravity
>Not that this piece of space junk has any gravity anyways, even with the reactor online
>Using one of your hooves to hold yourself to your captain's chair you align yourself carefully to the door at the back
>A gentle push propels you forward, carrying your lithe form through the cabin before seconds later you touch opposite end
>Taking holf of one of the many pipes moving along the wall you pull yourself to the airlock carefully and press the button next to it
>Frowning, you glare at the stubborn door and the fact that the emergency power decided to crap out on you as well
>In frustration you decide it is a great idea to kick the door, just to realize that every action has an equal reaction and in space there is nothing to stop you
>Going for a backwards tumble you flail your helpless hooves and even try flapping your wings to no avail
>No air and no gravity means your feathery (albeit covered by your flight suit) appendages are basically useless anyways
>Slamming head first into the console you attempt to rub your snout before remembering that, yeah, you have a helmet on and for good reason
>Sadly, while slamming onto your controls usually seems to work wonders, your little crash has done nothing but... broken off a small switch that now floats between your eyes
"Great, absolutely fucking amazing", you shout as you slam down a hoof on the console, immediately regretting it
>This time you were wise to hold yourself against one of the bars mounted to the console so you don't get thrown away, but now your hoof is hurting like a bitch
>Cursing, you turn back around and push yourself off again, much less graceful this time as your irritation gets the better of you
>Holding on to the wheel that serves as an override to the airlock's door, you begin to turn it with all the might that your quite frankly not exactly trained muscles can muster
>In absolute silence you struggle but eventually the probably rusted wheel begins to turn and the door slowly slides open
>Squeezing through the small gap you've managed to create you struggle a bit as your hindquarters decide to hinder your progress for just a few seconds

The entire digestive system is controlled by a totally separate nervous system - the enteric nervous system. In the absence of conscious control humans will still shit, and if eg. drunk they may feel they are about to shit but be unable to stop it.

There are several situations that would create evolutionary pressure for a central nervous system override. Hunting and hiding from being hunted - in both cases no ability to hold it in would create a major smell sign. Animals living in nests - for parasite reasons.

Horses don't have any reason to be able to hold it. All that was ever required was a short warning to move a short distance. It's been that way for a LOT longer than I ever intended for it to. I'm sorry for that; I'm sure most of you who played this back in its heyday (~2019 or so) are long gone... But that's alright. That's how life goes sometimes. There's no sense crying about the past, so let's move on. I'm back, and I'd like to continue this CYOA, with whoever's left and whoever is yet to come. >So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. >What is this general?
NEET/Misfit Pone is a thread for ponies who despite their best efforts (or in some cases complete lack thereof) struggle to fit in with the rest of society.

>What sort of stories can you expect to find here?
• Slice of life stuff.
• Lots of odd cute ponies becoming the waifu stories.
• Lots of being the cute oddball pony stories.
• A few NEET-recovery stories.
• A lot of smut, if you're into that.
• Lots of ponies to get you started with a variety of personalities and quirks. Don't like one of them? Give another NEET a try!
• Much, much more!

>Quick rundown on the pre-existing ponies ITT:
Floor Bored - The OG OC NEET from the very first threads. Floor comes in all different forms, but she's typically portrayed as a horny and kinda dirty mare most of the time. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2321489)
Pardise Skies - Paradise is a pony who started off as a NEET but ends up going to univeristy in a PiE setting. She's very quiet, easily spooked, likes to wear clothes and speaks with a stutter. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2289220)
Moon Dancer - Huge bookworm.
Taku - Friend of Floor who is *very* into anime. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1722376)
Goldie Mops - Goldie is another friend of Floors, only she's into kaiju and big monsters. Speaks with a cute lisp and seems very adorkable. (https://ponerpics.org/images/6192935)
Chimney Peep - Floor's sports nerd friend (Pic above, pony with the hat and lazy eye)
Home Sick - Probably the least covered NEET. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1727410)
Wallflower Blush, of Equestria girls fame but as a pone. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1658572)
Cuppa Noodle - Cuppa is a NEET snekpony who likes cup noodles and very tight hugs. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1892447)
Cipher the Programmer - The super paranoid overthinking male NEET-pony (https://derpibooru.org/images/2236987)
Dot Matrix - A pony who is into retro gaming. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2577975)
Anon Mare - Anon Mare is entirely up to your own interpretation. Same premise as Anon Filly but all grown up. The self-insert pony.
Writer's Block - A NEET pony whos background is currently unclear. Know anything about her? Let us know ITT (https://derpibooru.org/images/2561414)
Starry Sails - A chubby mare who lives in a PiE kind of setting. Friends with Anon. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2657594)

Videos include comic dubs, fanfic readings, animatics, song covers/parodies, fun Skype calls with voice actors messing around, and a bunch of dubs and parodies. The only videos of hers I did not upload were her NSFW fanfic readings (don't want to risk community guideline strikes), but those all can be found here: https://odysee.com/$/playlist/9afca968d751e62b80b628d925c5175a80c94eb2

Later today I will start uploading other content. I will be uploading miscellaneous content for the next few days or so (about 50 videos), then I'll upload BronyVids' stuff (about 100 videos), then I'll get to Saberspark, PaleoSteno, and the Everfree Network Podcasts! After that I'll probably upload Digibrony and BronyCurious.


If you want information on the content I am re-uploading, check the below link out for full descriptions of the content:
https://www.reddit.com/r/mylittlepony/comments/z3zfh5/deleted_mlp_videospodcasts_archive_saberspark/

And if you want a full list of the videos I am currently planning on re-uploading and links to the archives of them, check out the below link:

Thanks to the people at Pony Archive and Archive.org for preserving all of these videos, I found the vast majority of these videos from those two places. Without those people, all of this content would be long lost.

If you have any recommendation for videos you want me to find archives of, or have access to any missing videos from these channels not included in my spreadsheet, please let me know!
